options.text: The time during which a pilot is controlling an aircraft in flight solely by reference to instruments.
The time during which the flight is conducted according to Instrument Flight Rules.
The time during which a pilot is receiving instruction in simulated instrument flight, in flight simulation training devices (FSTD).
Flight time conducted in marginal weather conditions, with reference to the flight instruments.

variant.question: According to the relevant FCL requirements, the successful completion of multi-crew co-operation (MCC) training is one of the conditions required for..

options.text: a first type rating on multi-pilot aeroplanes.
a first class rating on multi-engine aeroplanes.
a professional pilot licence.
any revalidation of a rating on a multi-pilot aeroplane.
A categorisation of aircraft according to specified basic characteristics, for example aeroplane, powered-lift, helicopter, airship, sailplane, free balloon.
A categorisation of single pilot aeroplanes not requiring a type rating.
A categorisation of aircraft according to defined maximum all up mass in the take off configuration.
A categorisation of aircraft based upon performance, in terms of maximum operating speed and altitude.

variant.question: An applicant holding a private or commercial pilot licence aeroplane for the issue of an instrument rating, shall have completed ___ hours of cross-country flight time as pilot-in-command of aircraft in categories acceptable to the licensing Authority, of which not less than ___ hours shall be in aeroplanes.
According to PART-FCL, successful completion of multi-crew co-operation (MCC) training shall be required to:

options.text: obtain the first type rating on multi-pilot aeroplanes.
obtain the first class rating on multi-engine aeroplanes.
revalidate any rating or licence.
obtain a professional pilot licence.

variant.question: How is "Solo flight time" defined in Part FCL?

options.text: Flight time during which a student pilot is the sole occupant of an aircraft.
Flight time during which the student pilot is the sole manipulator of the flight controls from start-up to shut-down.
That time when the pilot is acting in command of the aircraft.
The student acting a pilot in command on a flight when the instructor is just observing.

variant.question: The flying training for a CPL (A), not including type rating training, shall comprise a total of at least 150 hours, to include all progress tests, of which up to 5 hours for the entire course may be instrument ground time. Within the total of 150 hours, applicants shall complete at least ___ of instrument flight instruction, of which up to 5 hours may be instrument ground time in an FNPT I, FTD 2, FNPT II or FFS.

options.text: 10 hours
25 hours
5 hours
15 hours

variant.question: Which option most accurately reflects the definition of ?multi-pilot aeroplanes?, according to Part-FCL?

options.text: Aeroplanes certificated for operation with a minimum crew of at least two pilots.
Civil aeroplanes certificated specifically for commercial operation and with a minimum crew of at least two pilots.
Aeroplanes certificated specifically for commercial operation and with a minimum crew of at least two pilots.
Aeroplanes that may be operated by a crew of one or two pilots.
